result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Frank Sardina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for ZERO DAYS time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes: PAY ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND DNA SURCHARGES WITHIN 2 YEARS OR CIVIL JUDGMENT SHALL BE ENTERED AGAINST THE DEFENDANT.

PAY WAUKESHA TICKET ON CASE 15FO520.
TAKE ANGER MANAGMENT CLASS.
PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $500.00 including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid FORTHWITH or serve 25 CONSECUTIVE days in the House of Correction.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Frank Sardina

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded as to COUNT THREE: 

Fine of $500.00 including  all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges  to be paid FORTHWITH or serve  25 CONSECUTIVE days in the House of Correction.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Joseph Frank Sardina in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS TWO AND THREE: 

 Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDER COUNT ONE:  DISMISSED AND READ IN AS TO SENTENCING.

AS TO COUNT TWO:

Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for ZERO DAYS time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS with the following conditions:
*AODA AND TREATMENT
*PAY WAUKESHA TICKET ON CASE 15FO520
*TAKE ANGER MANAGMENT CLASS
*PAY ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND DNA SURCHARGES WITHIN 2 YEARS OR CIVIL JUDGMENT SHALL BE ENTERED AGAINST THE DEFENDANT
*PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE

Defendant Joseph Frank Sardina in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Frank Sardina in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47  Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant ordered not to wear outlaw motorcycle gang colors.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearm Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JS (DOB 8/9/1971), MH (DOB 11/17/1962), or CH (DOB 4/26/68).

Defendant Joseph Frank Sardina in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 10/13/15 @ 1:30 pm
